I apologize but I am having a hard time understanding what the problem is, where the problem is, and what version it affects. Please pay attention to the issue template (https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/new) and provide all the information it asks. Thank you.

That said, based on what you've suggested, I would suspect the segfault is because of dual initialization of some global state. As @shreyneil pointed out, if you're adding an op, please follow the documentation at https://www.tensorflow.org/extend/, which will result in your custom library extension linking against pywrap_tensorflow.so and avoiding any global state conflicts.

If that doesn't seem to be the case, please feel free to file a new issue with all requested details and most importantly detailed instructions to reproduce the problem. Hope that helps, thanks!

body:
I apologize but I am having a hard time understanding what the problem is, where the problem is, and what version it affects. Please pay attention to the issue template (https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/new) and provide all the information it asks. Thank you.

That said, based on what you've suggested, I would suspect the segfault is because of dual initialization of some global state. As @shreyneil pointed out, if you're adding an op, please follow the documentation at https://www.tensorflow.org/extend/, which will result in your custom library extension linking against `pywrap_tensorflow.so` and avoiding any global state conflicts.

If that doesn't seem to be the case, please feel free to file a new issue with all requested details and most importantly detailed instructions to reproduce the problem. Hope that helps, thanks!
